contents.content:
Your Hubble plot was made from observations for a small sample of nearby galaxies. Rubin Observatory will detect millions of supernovae in host galaxies that are much farther away and dimmer than the galaxies you have investigated so far. This plot shows the galaxies you plotted in color, and data for over a thousand supernovae and galaxies (in grey) detected by Rubin Observatory.

Notice not all the data points fit onto the trendline.

A new observation can be made from this plot: The Hubble Constant is not the same throughout the history of the Universe. Many cosmologists attribute this change to the role of dark energy. Astronomers are actively engaged in new research to better understand the nature of dark energy. There are still many more secrets of the Universe to discover.
